did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gail and Stephen Rudin American presidential collection, 1860-2009
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Historical letters, documents and ephemera relating to American presidential campaigns from Abraham Lincoln to Barack Obama.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Historical letters, documents and ephemera relating to American presidential campaigns from Abraham Lincoln to Barack Obama. Newspapers include issues of the New York Times from Nov. 23-26, 1963, focusing on the assassination of President Kennedy and its aftermath.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS
descgrp.p: Other Presidential letters can be found in the Frank Thilly Papers, #14-21-623, Wilson, Taft; Johnson family papers, #4928, Adams; Jared Sparks Collection of Autographs, #4600 Bd. Ms. 548 ++, Washington.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gail and Stephen Rudin American presidential collection, #6844. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Series I. Abraham Lincoln
Documents

Lincoln, Abraham
Office held: As U.S. Representative from Illinois

scopecontent.p:
Lincoln's patent to lift boats over shoals, written while Lincoln served as a representative in the Illinois legislature. See separated materials below.
Rudin # L-1

list.head: Signed Books
list.item: Keeping Faith: Memoirs of a President, by Jimmy Carter, 1982.
A Time to Heal, by Gerald Ford, 1979.
No More Vietnams, by Richard Nixon. 2 copies, one unsigned.
The Audacity of Hope, by Barack Obama.
Report of the Commissioner of Patents for the year 1849, Office of Printers to the Senate. Contains patent listing for Abraham Lincoln.
